data.title: Patrick Gavin Duffy's Punch Cocktail Recipe
data.meta_description: to make a patrick gavin duffy's punch use cognac (brandy), bénédictine d.o.m. liqueur, sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°brix), orange juice (freshly
data.text:
Serve in a

Collins glass

Garnish:

Mint sprigs bouquet

How to make:

SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass.

Read about cocktail measures and measuring.

Gentle

Boozy

Sweet

Dry/sour

Review:

A full three ounces of alcohol per serve means this sure packs a tasty punch.

History:

Adapted from the following recipe in Patrick Gavin Duffy's 1934 The Official Mixer's Manual:

"Patrick Gavin Duffy's Punch

Juice of 1 rich Orange

1 Drink Brandy

½ Teaspoon Powdered sugar

½ Glass Benedictine

Shake in ice and pour all into tall glass, decorate with Mint and Fruit in season.

Drink through straw."

Nutrition:

One serving of Patrick Gavin Duffy's Punch contains 272 calories.

Alcohol content:

2.4 standardglas

18.26% alc./vol. (36.52° proof)

26.5 grams of pure alcohol

Difford's Guide remains free-to-use thanks to the support of the brands in green above. Values stated for alcohol and calorie content, and number of drinks an ingredient makes should be considered approximate.
